g.text: angle. The heading angle is also obtained by accumulating the heading angle variations
, which will lead to greater errors. The second source is the accuracy error of the
odometer itself and the measurement error during the experiment.
The heading angle measured by the IMU and the heading angle calculated by the odometer data
in the sampling period were used as the input parameters of the improved odometer positioning
method to calculate the coordinates. The experiments were performed ﬁve times. Figure
coordinate data obtained by the improved odometer positioning method.
factors. The heading angle measured by the IMU will affect the final positioning coordinate data of
The improved odometer positioning method combines the IMU, which can accurately reflect the
heading angle, and the odometer, which calculates the heading angle with a small error. It can obtain
better coordinates in the case of long-duration and long-distance operation. However, the IMU data
are susceptible to interference and large fluctuations. Hence, the independent use of the improved
odometer positioning method is not reliable.
Track of the delivery robot positioned by the improved odometer positioning method.
Track of the delivery robot positioned by the improved odometer positioning method.
